channel.title: Mb-speakers on Moinworld
channel.description: Recent content in Mb-speakers on Moinworld

item.title: Anja Blaß
item.description: About Anja Anja Blaß is a freelance dancer and dance teacher in the Hamburg area. She completed her three-year training at the Erika-Klütz School for Theatre Dance and Dance Pedagogy in Hamburg in 2015. She teaches ballet, Pilates, Modern Dance, Improvisation and Contemporary at the Tanzfabrik and the TSG Ballet School. Her projects include the architect, musician and dancer cooperation heroe_s as well as green_sleeves of HafenCity University and numerous projects of the dance orchestra Suse Tietjen.

item.title: Anja Schumann
item.description: About Anja Anja is the founder of moinworld. Prior to the non-profit she founded the Women Techmakers Meetup in Hamburg which is now part of moinworld. moinworld is her solution to closing the gender gap in IT. About Anja’s talk Anja will be part of the opening ceremony and welcome you to our conference.

item.title: Artiona Bogo
item.description: Talk name Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nam finibus, orci ut tincidunt vulputate, tortor erat maximus dolor, vel convallis ligula mi eu urna. Aliquam non tempus elit. Mauris ut accumsan libero. About Artonia Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.

item.title: Chiara Bachmann
item.description: About Chiara Chiara launched the Instagram channel Fräulein Finance almost a year ago. Fräulein Finance is about sharing financial knowledge with other young women. She has been involved with economics and finance since high school. The structure that goes along with the topic fascinates her. She is currently in the final stages of her Master’s in Finance.

item.title: Chiara Bachmann
item.description: About Chiara Money & finance coach passionate about supporting women managing their money and finances independently About Chiara’s Talks Women & Finance: Crypto Trading? Lay the foundation for your very first investment! Finances – a very important but still scary topic. Let’s talk about the three most essential steps, which must be done before building your investment strategy. Learn more about your money mindset, how to manage your money and what’s necessary when it comes to financial protection.

item.title: Christian Christian Schultze-Wolters
item.description: About Christian Christian Schultze-Wolters is Director of Blockchain Solutions DACH with IBM. He brings more than 25 years of sales experience in IBM, leading different sales teams in a national and international environment. After his responsibility for the Travel & Transportation industry in Germany he took over the lead for IBMs Blockchain business in Germany, Austria and Switzerland driving solutions and individual projects across all industries.

item.title: Citlali Mora Catlett
item.description: About Citlali Citlali Mora Catlett works in strategy and business development and is a course instructor at B9lab. After studying political science, economy and business administration at the LMU Munich, she discovered her passion of blockchain technology through her work at B9lab. As a result, she has expanded B9lab’s non-technical course offerings and has engaged in promoting the knowledge and critical analysis of blockchain implementations. About Citlali’s Talk What can you use smart contracts for?

item.title: Claudia Terpstra
item.description: About Claudia Claudia’s background is in Supply Chain and Finance and later learned how to code. She now works as a blockchain specialist in the Blockchain Acceleration Lab of the Rabobank, where she is accelerating blockchain initiatives within the bank. Read more about her in this article. Claudia’s Talk Blockchain can have a great impact in the area of trade finance. This domain is still characterized by lots of paperwork and manual effort.

item.title: Dr. Carmen Schneider
item.description: About Carmen Dr. Carmen Schneider is a lawyer and partner with Chatham Partners LLP in Hamburg. She studied law in Gießen and Bonn and obtained her doctorate in the field of energy law after a research period at Centre de Recherche en Economie et Droit de l’Energie in Montpellier, France. Her clients include utilities, investors, and project developers in the energy industry. She focuses on project development, energy contract law, regulatory and energy trading.

item.title: Dr. Carolin Raspé
item.description: About Carolin Dr. Caroline Raspé is a lawyer specialized in regulatory law and compliance. She studied at Bucerius Law School in Hamburg and LUISS in Rome and then worked with Hengeler Mueller in Berlin and Davis Polk in New York. Her interest in blockchain started while working in New York on a big Cybersecurity project for multiple international clients in 207⁄2018 when the GDPR as well as various federal US regulations on data security took effect.

item.title: Dr. Elena Mechik
item.description: About Elena Elena Mechik completed her studies at Touro College Berlin in 2008 with a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration. In 2011 she graduated in Industrial Engineering and Management from the Technical University of Berlin. In 2014 she completed an advanced training in development economics at the London School of Economics. Since 2011, Elena has been researching ways to mitigate the illegal deforestation of tropical forests. In this context, she learned about blockchain technology.

item.title: Dr. Julia Schlösser-Rost
item.description: About Julia Julia Schlösser-Rost is a lawyer specialized in public commercial law with a focus on data protection, information security and healthcare. She studied German and French law in Potsdam and Paris and worked with Hengeler Mueller in Frankfurt and Berlin and Slaughter and May in London. Her interest in blockchain started because of its potential to make data and information exchanges more secure and efficient. About Julia’s talk EU Data Privacy - a challenge for blockchain applications The EU has implemented high standards when it comes to data protection and information security.

item.title: Dr. Michael Müller-Wünsch
item.description: About Michael Dr Michael Müller-Wünsch is responsible for the online retailer’s IT environment as member of the OTTO Management Board (CIO). Michael is a seasoned manager of IT change processes and IT development. Prior to Otto Michael was Chief Information Officer (CIO) of Lekkerland AG & Co. KG and responsible for restructuring its European IT operations and standardising its IT environment as well as its business and IT processes. Prior to that, Müller-Wünsch was a partner at HiSolutions AG in Berlin, a Managing Director of CEVA Logistics GmbH in Frankfurt am Main and from 2000 to 2004 he was Executive Director and Chief Operating Officer (COO) of myToys.

item.title: Dr. Natalie Tillack
item.description: About Natalie Dr. Natalie Tillack is managing director and founder of DenkFabrik.io, a Berlin-based consulting firm that deals with the development of market entry strategies for blockchain in industry, business and education. DenkFabrik develops application cases and investment theses for classical (non-blockchain) companies, investors and universities as well as for selected blockchain companies. Natalie holds a PhD in Computer Aided Physics and a PhD in 2016 from Oxford University. She then worked as an associate at McKinsey & Company, driving digital projects and leading pro bono consulting projects for the German start-up ecosystem.

item.title: Dr. Torsten Sevecke
item.description: About Torsten Since 2018 Dr. Torsten Sevecke is the State Councillor in the ministry of Economy, Transport and Innovation and is responsible for innovation and economic development in Hamburg. He drives forward new ideas in the fields of digitalisation and new technology solutions to make Hamburg a more innovative city. Dr. Torsten Sevecke comes from a juridical background since he studied and awarded a doctor in law at the University of Hamburg.

item.title: Dr. Uve Samuels
item.description: About Uve Dr. Uve Samuels, 51, has been Managing Director of the HSBA Hamburg School of Business Administration since 2007. During this time, the school has developed into one of the leading business schools in Germany. Since March 2019 he has also been Managing Director of SQUARE HSBA Innovation HUB. Samuels studied Process Automation/Applied Computer Science at the FH Ostfriesland from 1994-1996. In 1997 and 1998 Samuels completed a Master’s degree at Loughborough University of Technology in England, where he also earned a doctorate in microsystems technology.

item.title: Georgia Rakusen
item.description: About Georgia Georgia Rakusen is Design Research Lead at ConsenSys, supporting the design and build of decentralised systems and applications for web 3.0. As a user researcher who has worked both in-house and agency side (at Europe’s leading usability testing company), she has interviewed more than 1000 individual research participants for organisations and businesses including the UK Government, Cisco, Sky, Marks & Spencer, and Financial Times. A crypto early-adopter, and an idealist, she spends her time evangelising for designers and engineers working in blockchain to get out of their bubbles and discover the real needs of end users.

item.title: Joachim Lohkamp
item.description: About Joachim Joachim Lohkamp is an entrepreneur and tech-enthusiast with a heart foractivism. As the founder of Jolocom, he has been working at the forefront of the decentralization movement in Berlin since 2014. With Jolocom, he is providing the identity solution that will enable real world use cases in smart contract based business models. To ultimately harvest this potential and inform innovation aimed regulation, he co-founded the German Blockchain Association (Bundesblock) that establishes the dialogue between blockchain businesses and politics.

item.title: Julia Evelyn Larsen
item.description: About Julia Julia is the co-founder of CryptoWomen CPH and just finished her master’s thesis at CBS on the topic of blockchain for social good. She has interned for the Danish Foreign Ministry’s Innovation Department in Germany where she helped to set up partnerships between tech startups and big companies and learned to think across borders and in terms of innovation eco-systems. Using tech for good and making tech accessible for all are her core focus areas, and her current project is setting up a PyLadies chapter in Copenhagen.

item.title: Malcolm Cannon
item.description: About Malcolm Malcolm spent a decade as a Commercial Copywriter, then six years as a Growth Specialist. In 2016 he made my first crypto investments, and by the end of 2017 he began focusing his activity to all things blockchain. In 2018 he co-founded a crypto fund on the ICONOMI investment platform, and became an Angel Investor and CMO for Cyberian Mine. Recently Malcolm helped close Cyberian Mine’s €4.75M Post-money valuation Seed Round and prior to that he built the Growth Team at CareerFoundry leading to their €4M raise at Series A.

item.title: Marion Vogel
item.description: About Marion Marion has her professional origins in the automotive industry. After completing her MBA in Marketing Management, she moved to San Francisco where she worked in Business Development for the Bavarian Ministry of Economic Affairs. A lucky coincidence brought her to Bitcoin in 2014 and she is still fascinated by it today. Since 2016 she has been part of the Blockchain Project aeternity and is President of the aeternity Crypto Foundation, which is based in Liechtenstein.

item.title: Mary Camacho
item.description: About Mary Mary Camacho is social scientist and tech entrepreneur working to usher in a new era of distributed Internet. She holds an M.A. from the University of Chicago and has held leadership positions with software and telecom companies for over 20 years. As a serial entrepreneur in purpose driven startups, she has led teams of developers to design and build software solutions from concept to market success and has mentored other tech founders to successful funding and launch.

item.title: Nicole Zhu
item.description: About Nicole Nicole Zhu is an engineer at Parity Technologies working on building the 3rd, decentralised Web. She works on Substrate, an open-source blockchain builder, that enables anyone with a compelling use-case to easily build and connect their businesses on top of a blockchain. Formerly, she was the Vice President of Fraud & Risk at GO-JEK, a fin-tech and ride hailing conglomerate in Southeast Asia, where she led a team of 70 fraud busters.

item.title: Oliver Terbu
item.description: About Oliver Oliver Terbu, Identity Architect & uPort Standards Lead - Oliver Terbu studied Computer Science and Economics at the Technical University of Graz. He is an Identity Subject Matter Expert with ConsenSys / uPort and has more than 8 years experience in the identity area in highly regulated industries. He designs architectures and solutions for clients integrating with uPort’s Trusted Management Platform based on the Ethereum Blockchain. He is now chairing the DID Auth WG in DIF and is an active member and contributor of different standardization bodies in the blockchain- and identity space including Decentralized Identity Foundation (DIF), W3C, Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA), International Association of Trusted Blockchain Applications (INATBA), CEN/CENELEC and ISO.

item.title: Susi Förschler
item.description: About Susi Susi Foerschler joined the international law firm DWF as an associate last year. Susi has a profound interest in new technology. She works on mandates applying blockchain in real estate as well as on questions of KYC/AML in the ICO context. Susi has a background in international and comparative law and is used to dealing with multi-jurisdictional issues as they arise in blockchain use cases. About Susi’s Talk Panel: Blockchain and legal challenges

item.title: Valeria Podmogilnij
item.description: About Valeria Research assistant at the research unit for legal technology and doctoral candidate at Humboldt University Law School Valeria is a research assistant and doctoral candidate at the research unit for legal technology. She studied at the European University Viadrina and Humboldt University in Berlin and holds a law degree. Valeria works on legal implications regarding legal tech-applications with focus on data protection requerements. As part of her reaserach, she examines the business models of the legal tech providers and is in constant contact with Startups.

item.title: Volker Skwarek
item.description: About Volker Educated as Electrical Engineer, spent more than 1 decade in managing responsibility for research and technical development in automotive industry. Now professor for embedded systems, convenor in ISO TC 307 (Blockchain) for WG 3, “Smart Contracts”, and leading a research group for blockchains with ultra low powered devices.
